channel.title: Client for my server help

item.title: Client for my server help
item.dc:creator: @suppyscape suppyscape
item.description:
@suppyscape wrote:

OK, so I have a server and I also have a client. When someone downloads my client it has an error that says “error reconnecting in 10…9…8 etc” and it counts down and never connects, I think the problem is with the compiler @echo off :menu title StabbingScape compiler @echo Compiling..... if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\InternetExplorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Compiling Finished. pause exit I am not sure if its my compiler or not, but is there a way i can make my client so it doesn’t need jdk to download?

Read full topic
